extracted-table.table-caption: Networks in which NBS revealed a negative effect of esketamine on dynamic rsFC.

caption.p: Networks in which NBS revealed a negative effect of esketamine on dynamic rsFC.

table-wrap-foot.p: Illustrates networks elucidated through NBS31. In these networks, regression coefficients between dynamic rsFC time-course and esketamine plasma levels differed significantly between the esketamine and placebo conditions, demonstrating a significant effect of esketamine on dynamic rsFC. All networks were found for the comparison esketamine < placebo.
Edges = number of connections, nodes = number of regions.
Exponentially weighted sliding-window based on Zalesky et al.25, multiplication of temporal derivatives based on Shine et al.26.
Craddock and Power denote parcellations based on Craddock et al.29 and Power et al.30.
Extent and intensity statistics based on NBS31.

extracted-table.table-caption: Individual connections for which NBS revealed a negative influence of esketamine on dynamic rsFC across all methodological approaches.

caption.p: Individual connections for which NBS revealed a negative influence of esketamine on dynamic rsFC across all methodological approaches.

table-wrap-foot.p: Illustrates individual region to region connections for which NBS31 showed that esketamine had a significant negative influence on dynamic rsFC regardless of which methodological approach was used. Coordinates from the Craddock and Power atlases were translated to AAL and corresponding Yeo networks are noted to improve interpretability.
x = coordinates from Craddock atlas29 or Power atlas30, but not denoted in AAL.
*Networks based on Yeo et al.32, **Regions based on Harvard-Oxford atlas.
